name: Azul Fives Hotel, by Karisma

reviews.text: Like many others, I was a little worried about staying at Azul Fives from reading the reviews. BUT, I cannot say enough positive things about this resort. It was by far the most beautiful place we've stayed in. I've been to Mexico several times, and at high-end resorts, but we just had a wonderful experience here. Travelled with my husband and three children - ages 24, 20 and 12, and my 20 yrs. old's friend, who is 25. While my 12 year old wanted nothing to do with the Kids area, she was happy to spend the entire time with us. From the moment we arrived, we had a friendly greeting and offered "azul/blue" colored champagne as a welcome. My 12 year old daughter was given a nice cool bottle of water, which was very refreshing for her! While they did have the cool refresher towels there also, we were not offered them - not sure why, and we didn't ask. After we took a family photo for our room keys, we arrived before our 2 bedroom suite was ready. I took the advice of several travellers who left reviews, and asked for a suite in Villa 14 - and they accomodated us. Yes, Villa 14 is the place to be! It is in the center of everything - from the restaurants to the infinity pool and the beach. We left our luggage with them, as they said it would be taken to our suite when ready, and because we arrived almost 2 hours prior to check-in, we were able to get some lunch. As we were all driven by golf cart to the walkway to the beach, (which we really could have walked), we had lunch at the bbq area, which was delicious. The guys that prepare lunch here are so friendly, and everyone just about knows very good English. However, it was fun for my kids to brush up on their Spanish with many of the staff! After lunch, we walked around the resort and to the beautiful turquoise ocean. They had afternoon volleyball everyday as well as soccer and bocce ball. We really enjoyed the Salsa lessons too right by the pool. After we were driven to our room, and walked into our suite, we were in absolute awe. The suites are beautiful! With our two bedroom suite, there were separate entrances for both bedrooms, but connected through the main entrance. The kitchen, dining and living rooms were connected to the master room, with french doors for privacy. Each bedroom had its own patio with sliding doors, and right outside your bedroom was the sparkling pool - like a lazy river that went all throughout the resort. Several pool swim-up bars were all around as well. The restaurants were very good, and Sea Olive was our absolute favorite. Roberto, our favorite waiter really took good care of us! We actually ate there for lunch and dinner on the same day! While tipping is not necessary, we tipped everyone, as they all gave us such wonderful service. Domingo always took care of us at the pool bars, and if you want top shelf liquor, it's your's for the asking. The capacity the week we were there was about half full, which was nice to not have to wait for seating in any of the restaurants. Breakfast at Flavours was your typical breakfast buffet, but enough of a variety where you can something different every day. The sushi that everyone raved about on other reviews was just OK, it was your typical sushi -- but again, the wonderful service made it very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous!

reviews.text: The beach, as told by others, is not one to swim in, however, is wonderful for beach volleyball, and soccer. We did not mind at all walking down to the other resorts to their beach. One day we ventured to the right of our beach, which was about a five minute walk, and that was pleasant. The next day we went to our left, about a ten minute walk, and that's where they had wave-runners and parasailing if you wanted, and the beach there was magnificent. The sand is so soft under your feet, and the beautiful, crystal clear ocean was remarkable. At this beach, you can walk about a mile into the ocean and still only be up to your waist in the water!
reviews.title: very nice place

reviews.text: Our family really enjoyed ourselves at this resort, and would definitely come back again. We didn't want to leave! We had beautiful weather, with just a slight sprinkle for about ten minutes in the early morning just enough to give the landscaping a drink. I would definitely recommend this resort for anyone who is looking for something a little different, expecting great service and memories that will last a lifetime!
reviews.title: read before booking
Full and Happy
reviews.text: I am a world traveler, been going to Cancun/ Playa area every 3-4 weeks within 12 month.

1 bd suit is very nice!!! Food was great! Service was good, do not have to wear wrist band for all inclusive , very clean, soooooo quiet inside the room, can not hear who is next door or outside. Love it! Beach not the best , but could walk to the next resort...
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings - It is Very Good but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've been to several all inclusive resorts and after the first day I was basically wanting to leave. I was really disappointed, bored and hungry.
reviews.title: Bored to tears and food was terrible

reviews.text: All the resorts in Mexico are pretty remote from anything fun and exciting and if you want to go anywhere off the resort you need to arrange transportation to get around. The resort had basically NOTHING to do.
reviews.title: Fair to Middling
Luxury resort with exceptional service and attention to detail
reviews.text: I booked a 1BR suite on bookit.com because you receive a $500 coupon book of offers. We ended up being upgraded to a penthouse suite because our room smelled a bit funny because there was water leaking throughout our place.
We went to the pool.
reviews.title: Love it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to the gym.
reviews.title: Fun and Relaxing adventure

reviews.text: I visited Azul Fives over Labor Day weekend. I visited over labor day weekend as guests of some friends who were renting a penthouse for a wedding party. The problems started as soon as we walked in the door. Despite being notified by our friends who were staying there, the desk staff seemed slow to understand that we were visiting and initially would not let us in on the property. They made us stand around for 20 mins while we were explaining that our friends were at a reception and were not reachable at their room. Finally after considerable amounts of pleading, someone tracked down a manager who knew we were coming and we were cleared. If only it were that easy. We basically had to sign three pages of waivers and turn over our driver's license before they let us in the property. What. The. Heck.The worst part was that there were three people in the front. Two girls who were mostly inoffensive, but deferential to the male who worked at the desk. His name was Angel. More about him later.
reviews.title: Beautiful property, INCOMPETENT and OFFENSIVE service

reviews.text: Once we entered, it took us 20 mins before they managed to flag down a golf cart to drive us to the reception site. This wouldn't be so terrible if the golf cart station wasn't right next to the lobby with plenty of empty carts and staff hanging around the front.
reviews.title: run from this place fast!!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Once in the property it was great. Beautifully laid out, brand new, great rooms, great views.
reviews.title: Super Time!

reviews.text: We returned to my friend's penthouse to chat and grab some food. Our friends were on the all inclusive plan and we were all hungry so I called the operator to connect us to room service. Angel picked up. I politely asked for room service and he gruffly responded "When are you leaving?"
reviews.title: Good for the money

reviews.text: I was stunned. I have visited hotels and resorts all over the world. I have NEVER been addressed in such a rude and inhospitable manner. I responded, "Excuse me?" and he went on to rant that he knew I wasn't a guest there and how I couldn't order food, yadda...yadda..yadda.
reviews.title: Great accomodations for a large family! Great service as well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got a good deal on a very classy one bedroom suite with kitchen, living room and balcony. The suite wad great, no maintenance problems, very clean. We opted to cook all our own food (we like to cook) or get takeout and really enjoyed that - we were glad we didn't rely on the restaurants here. For very little cash you can get lovely fresh fish, great ingredients, and wonderful top-shelf booze and prepare it in your own granite and stainless steel fully equipped kitchen. Staff are eager to help you to your room with groceries and we did not feel judged in any way for cooking our own food. Pools are wonderful and are through the whole resort. We had a car and drove into Playa for supplies, shopping etc. at least once a day.
reviews.title: Good deal with self-catering but...

reviews.text: We would not have liked this place so much if we were stuck there without a car. As others have said, the beach is rocky and tiny - it's not even good for snorkelling. We were mistakenly showed to a "one bedroom suite" without a kitchen and told this was our room. We then had to wait two hours in the lobby, without use of any facilities, to get the room we'd reserved. Apparently this was because there was nobody present senior enough to give us the room we'd actually reserved. The non-kitchen suite we were shown by mistake was a bit small and pokey, and we would not recommend those if you're going to spend time in your room. Others have indicated problems with incorrect reservations here and we experienced this too.
reviews.title: Money Poorly Spent - Maybe should be named Azul Twos?

reviews.text: The rooftop suites looked very good. However, there are not any true ocean-front rooms here. It did not look like any ocean views were worth having either.
reviews.title: saved by a nightmare at dreams tulum

reviews.text: The staff were overall very friendly and helpful, but as well as the reservations we had long waits and other issues with valet parking (our car was recovered one time by a young staff member who did not appear to know how to drive).
reviews.title: Great Vacation, Nice Resort

reviews.text: Overall, we recommend this place if you are looking for a luxurious base to stay and cook your own food while you explore locations in the Riviera Maya by car and are OK with some SNAFUs.
reviews.title: Beautiful, relaxing week

aka: Azul Fives By Karisma Hotel Playa Del Carmen
description: Located just 10 minutes from charming playa del carmen, azul fives hotel is noted for enormous suites designed for families and friends with up to three bedrooms with rooftop decks.Activities and special experiences foster togetherness for families, couples and groups of friends. The 360-suite hotel offers the renowned Gourmet Inclusive® concept, as well as flexible meal plan options to suit all agendas. Private barbecues highlight family activities, and the Kid’s Club sponsored by Fisher-Price® caters to children. Rooftop Weddings inspire soon-to-be-married couples. The 24-hour room service and full-service concierge ensure memorable vacations.
